explanation: No additional symbols are required. The target function body contains no for loops and makes no function calls — it only contains (void) casts of its parameters. Therefore there are no loop headers or called-function behaviours to inspect against the MISRA C for-loop rule. The parameter types (struct linux_bus, struct linux_device, struct metal_sg, and uint32_t) are not used in any expressions or loops in the function body, so their definitions cannot affect whether this function violates the rule.
